siage.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

sialb.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sialb.comment: Mean surface albedo of entire ice-covered part of grid cell

siareaacrossline.long_name: Sea ice area flux through straits
siareaacrossline.comment: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelego = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)

siarean.comment: total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

siareas.comment: total area of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

sicompstren.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sicompstren.comment: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P*hexp(-C(1-A)))

siconc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
siconc.comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice

siconco.comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice

sidconcdyn.long_name: sea-ice area fraction change from dynamics
sidconcdyn.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)

sidconcth.long_name: sea-ice area fraction change from thermodynamics
sidconcth.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes

sidivvel.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
sidivvel.long_name: Divergence of the sea-ice velocity field
sidivvel.comment: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)

sidmassdyn.comment: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area

sidmassevapsubl.long_name: sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation
sidmassevapsubl.comment: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area

sidmassgrowthbot.long_name: sea-ice mass change through basal growth
sidmassgrowthbot.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area.

sidmassgrowthwat.long_name: sea-ice mass change through growth in supercooled open water (aka frazil)
sidmassgrowthwat.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth

sidmasslat.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)

sidmassmeltbot.long_name: sea-ice mass change through bottom melting
sidmassmeltbot.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area

sidmassmelttop.long_name: sea-ice mass change through surface melting
sidmassmelttop.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area

sidmasssi.long_name: sea-ice mass change through snow-to-ice conversion
sidmasssi.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

sidmassth.comment: Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area

sidmasstranx.comment: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

sidmasstrany.comment: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

sidragbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sidragbot.comment: Oceanic drag coefficient that is used to calculate the oceanic momentum drag on sea ice

sidragtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sidragtop.comment: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice

siextentn.comment: Total area of all Northern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

siextents.comment: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

sifb.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sifb.comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

siflcondbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflcondbot.long_name: Net conductive heat fluxes in ice at the bottom
siflcondbot.comment: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base

siflcondtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflcondtop.long_name: Net conductive heat flux in ice at the surface
siflcondtop.comment: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface

siflfwbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflfwbot.comment: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)

siflfwdrain.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflfwdrain.comment: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive.

sifllatstop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sifllatstop.long_name: Net latent heat flux over sea ice
sifllatstop.comment: the net latent heat flux over sea ice

sifllwdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sifllwdtop.long_name: Downwelling longwave flux over sea ice
sifllwdtop.comment: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)

sifllwutop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sifllwutop.long_name: Upward longwave flux over sea ice
sifllwutop.comment: the upward longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

siflsaltbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflsaltbot.comment: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; salt flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean

siflsenstop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflsenstop.long_name: Net sensible heat flux over sea ice
siflsenstop.comment: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice

siflsensupbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflsensupbot.long_name: Net sensible heat flux under sea ice
siflsensupbot.comment: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean

siflswdbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflswdbot.long_name: Downwelling shortwave flux under sea ice
siflswdbot.comment: the downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice (always positive)

siflswdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflswdtop.long_name: Downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice
siflswdtop.comment: the downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always positive by sign convention)

siflswutop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siflswutop.long_name: Upward shortwave flux over sea ice
siflswutop.comment: the upward shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

siforcecoriolx.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siforcecoriolx.long_name: Coriolis force term in force balance (x-component)
siforcecoriolx.comment: X-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

siforcecorioly.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siforcecorioly.long_name: Coriolis force term in force balance (y-component)
siforcecorioly.comment: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

siforceintstrx.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siforceintstrx.long_name: Internal stress term in force balance (x-component)
siforceintstrx.comment: X-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

siforceintstry.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siforceintstry.long_name: Internal stress term in force balance (y-component)
siforceintstry.comment: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

siforcetiltx.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siforcetiltx.long_name: Sea-surface tilt term in force balance (x-component)
siforcetiltx.comment: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

siforcetilty.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siforcetilty.long_name: Sea-surface tilt term in force balance (y-component)
siforcetilty.comment: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

sihc.long_name: Sea-ice heat content per unit area
sihc.comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water

siitdconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siitdconc.long_name: Sea-ice area fractions in thickness categories
siitdconc.comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by each ice-thickness category (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis)

siitdsnconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)
siitdsnconc.long_name: Snow area fractions in thickness categories
siitdsnconc.comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by snow in each ice-thickness category (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis)

siitdsnthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)
siitdsnthick.comment: Actual thickness of snow in each  category (NOT volume divided by grid area),  (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)

siitdthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)
siitdthick.comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each  category (NOT volume divided by grid area),  (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)

simass.comment: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area

simassacrossline.long_name: Sea mass area flux through straits
simassacrossline.comment: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelego = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)

simpconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
simpconc.long_name: Percentage Cover of Sea-Ice by Meltpond
simpconc.comment: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

simpmass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)
simpmass.comment: Meltpond mass per area of sea ice.

simprefrozen.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)
simprefrozen.long_name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
simprefrozen.comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area

sipr.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sipr.comment: mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

sirdgconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sirdgconc.long_name: Percentage Cover of Sea-Ice by Ridging
sirdgconc.comment: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

sirdgthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=sirdgconc - ridges only)
sirdgthick.comment: Sea Ice Ridge Height (representing mean height over the ridged area)

sisali.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sisali.comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell

sisaltmass.long_name: Mass of salt in sea ice per area
sisaltmass.comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

sishevel.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
sishevel.long_name: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field
sishevel.comment: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant)

sisnconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sisnconc.comment: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.

sisnhc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sisnhc.comment: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.

sisnmass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sisnmass.comment: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area

sisnthick.cell_methods: area: mean where snow over sea_ice area: time: mean where sea_ice
sisnthick.comment: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)

sispeed.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sispeed.comment: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice

sistremax.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
sistremax.long_name: Maximum shear stress in sea ice
sistremax.comment: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant)

sistresave.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
sistresave.long_name: Average normal stress in sea ice
sistresave.comment: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)

sistrxdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sistrxdtop.long_name: X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice
sistrxdtop.comment: X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

sistrxubot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sistrxubot.long_name: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice
sistrxubot.comment: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

sistrydtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sistrydtop.long_name: Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice
sistrydtop.comment: Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

sistryubot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sistryubot.long_name: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice
sistryubot.comment: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

sitempbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sitempbot.comment: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer

sitempsnic.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sitempsnic.comment: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero

sitemptop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sitemptop.comment: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

sithick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sithick.comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

sitimefrac.long_name: Fraction of time steps with sea ice
sitimefrac.comment: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

siu.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siu.comment: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

siv.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
siv.comment: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

sivol.comment: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

sivoln.comment: total volume of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

sivols.comment: total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

sndmassdyn.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Avection by Sea-ice Dynamics
sndmassdyn.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through advection with sea ice divided by grid-cell area

sndmassmelt.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Melt
sndmassmelt.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area

sndmasssi.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
sndmasssi.comment: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

sndmasssnf.long_name: snow mass change through snow fall
sndmasssnf.comment: mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

sndmasssubl.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Evaporation or Sublimation
sndmasssubl.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by grid-cell area

sndmasswindrif.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Wind Drift of Snow
sndmasswindrif.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through wind drift of snow (from sea-ice into the sea) divided by grid-cell area

snmassacrossline.comment: net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelego = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
